properties.name: Future Site of Roswell East Development
properties.description: Posted by EmilyjanehortonWe are told that Charlie Brown, the developer of Atlantic Station in Midtown, Atlanta is going to put up another mixed-use development but this time in Roswell. The development site would be from the marker I placed on the map up to Holcomb Bridge Rd. It\'s going to be offices, condos, shopping, lakes, walking paths and European-style plazas. They are coining it a "green urbanism" development as the plan is to keep a significant majority of the land green-space with an easement along the river. In order to do all these wonderful things on 107-acres, however, they are planning 19 high rise buildings towering as high as 27 stories. I think it will be an attractive addition to Roswell\'s otherwise unattractive shopping options but there\'s a whole lot of controversy. Some people are concerned that more high rise buildings will start sprouting up, making Roswell another high rise haven instead of a residential community outside of the city. There are sewer issues already plaguing the neighboring community of Martin\'s Landing without the additional 3000 residential homes proposed, and of course, traffic is a major concern as well. It\'s already bad. They have mentioned that new freeway on and off ramps will be put in but I can\'t imagine that\'s going to be enough. They had better sell Roswell on a much better flow of traffic on and off the freeway. Just getting to the freeway in the morning can take 20 minutes and I live within a mile of the entrance ramp. They expect the 2.1 billion dollar development plan will increase the price of Martin\'s Landing properties that are literally across the street. I would imagine that our proximity to the redevelopment would also make our land value rise as we are a very short drive or a nice walk to the future site but if traffic gets any worse, it will be a deterrent for people looking to Roswell to escape the city life. It\'s a most interesting time to be living in Roswell. I\'m happy to witness the changes and be a part of it all. Roswell may prove to be a lucrative place to live in the next few years. There will be many months of deliberations in the meantime and if approved, a couple years of development. We likely won\'t see the impact on Roswell for several years to come.

properties.name: Historic Roswell
properties.description: Posted by EmilyjanehortonWhat a charming set of shops, restaurants and old homes turned into businesses.We enjoy coming here to search through the antique stores and eat at the restaurants.

properties.name: J Christophers Breakfast Spot
properties.description: Posted by EmilyjanehortonRob and I love coming here for a weekend breakfast. It\'s better than homemade and cheap.

properties.name: Joli Kobe Bakery
properties.description: Posted by EmilyjanehortonYummy croissants, breads, cakes & tarts!

properties.name: Local Watering Hole
properties.description: Posted by EmilyjanehortonThis place is pretty fun. We like playing darts. They have pool tables and bands play at the weekends. We look forward to hanging out on the patio when it gets warm outside.

properties.name: Our Home
properties.description: Posted by Emilyjanehorton 9435 River Lake Dr. Roswell GA 30075I included some pictures of the front and back of the house. I\'m looking forward to enjoying our patio again soon...

properties.name: River Lake's Lake
properties.description: Posted by Emilyjanehorton This lake is across the street from our house. It makes up the backyard of some of our neighbors. It is the reason our street is called River Lake Dr. We have both a river and a lake...

properties.name: Roswell Park - On the River
properties.description: Posted by Emilyjanehorton  We like to walk to this park because it\'s on the river. Unlike the Riverside Park across the street from our cul de sac which is not riverfront.

properties.name: Smith Plantation
properties.description: Posted by EmilyjanehortonThis was in interesting little tour. We got a private tour of the interior of the oldest house in Roswell. Then took a walk along the property outside to see the out houses. The Smiths owned the land as far as the eye could see in the early years harvesting cotton and crops. They stayed afloat selling off parcels of land to new comers who seemed to congregate down Mimosa Blvd. There you will see several gorgeous antebellum mansions.

properties.name: Trader Joes Roswell
properties.description: Posted by Emilyjanehorton635 W. Crossville Road Roswell, GA 30075My favorite California Store now in Atlanta! I wanted to hug the employees of TJs when I walked in for the first time. I was so happy to see the inside of the store again with all their awesome food. It made me feel at home again. I go to this TJs on the weekends because it\'s closer to home. I love having two to choose from!

properties.name: Trader Joes Sandy Springs
properties.description: Posted by Emilyjanehorton 6277 Roswell Rd. NE Sandy Springs, GA 30328My favorite California Store now in Atlanta! I wanted to hug the employees of TJs when I walked in for the first time. I was so happy to see the inside of the store again with all their awesome food. It made me feel at home again. I go to this Trader Joes during the week on my way home from work. It\'s perfectly centered in between the office and home.
